sentence.Network_en: It is being actively pursued by amphibian specialists, for example.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (in the sense 'having two modes of existence or of doubtful nature'): from modern Latin amphibium 'an amphibian', from Greek amphibion (noun use of amphibios 'living both in water and on land', from amphi 'both' + bios 'life')

entry.def: Amphibians are animals such as frogs and toads that can live both on land and in water.
An amphibian is a vehicle which is able to move on both land and water, or an aeroplane which can land on both land and water.

means.word_mean: 1. a flat-bottomed motor vehicle that can travel on land or water
2. an airplane designed to take off and land on water
3. cold-blooded vertebrate typically living on land but breeding in water; aquatic larvae undergo metamorphosis into adult form
1. relating to or characteristic of animals of the class Amphibia

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词和形容词,"……地方,……人或动物等"; 2. ……的

ruffi=brutal残忍的,兽性的+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.恶棍,歹徒 adj.残暴的

urb城市+an表示地方→adj.城市的,市内的
veter+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.老兵,老手;老兵的; adj.经验丰富的
